oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Opening announcement - Tennessee Department of Tourism - Official Announcement of the Birthplace of Country Music Museum - 2014-06-10
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Official announcement of the opening of the Birthplace of Country Music Museum in Bristol Tennessee from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on June 10, 2014.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Eddie Stubbs; Susan Whitaker; Marty Stuart; Rusty Morrell; Carl Jackson; The Church Sisters; Barry Mazor; The Shotgun Rubies; The Chuck Wagon Gang; Leah Ross; Chris Canfield;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Master of ceremonies is Eddie Stubbs. Includes audio from video and selected recorded audio excerpts. Comments from Tennessee Department of Tourism Development commissioner Susan Whitaker; Marty Stuart; Rusty Morrell; Carl Jackson, Barry Mazor; Leah Ross; Chris Canfield. Performances from the album Orthophonic Joy: The 1927 Bristol Sessions Revisited include; Where We'll Never Grow Old (The Church Sisters) -- Black Eyed Susie (Marty Stuart) -- I Am Resolved (The Shotgun Rubies) -- Shall We Gather At The River (The Chuck Wagon Gang)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Stubbs, Eddie; Stuart, Marty; Jackson, Carl; Morrell, Rusty; Mazor, Barry; the Church Sisters (Musical group); the Shotgun Rubies (Musical group); the Churck Wagon Gang (Musical group); Whitaker, Susan; Ross, Leah; Canfield, Chris; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.); Tennessee Department of Tourism Development;
